```{r}
rm(list = ls())
df = read.csv("machine_learning_week_0.csv", header = TRUE)
# find two largest variance rows

find_variance_and_plot <- function(df) {
  var_first = colnames(df)[1]
  var_second = colnames(df)[2]
  for (i in colnames(df)){
    current_var = var(df[[i]])
    if (current_var >= var(df[[var_first]])) {
      var_first = i
    } else if (current_var >= var(df[[var_second]])) {
      var_second = i
    }
  }
  var_first<-sub("V", "", var_first)
  var_second<-sub("V", "", var_second)
  plot(df[[as.integer(var_first)]], df[[as.integer(var_second)]], main = "Exercise 5")
}

find_variance_and_plot(df)

```
